conclusion: Given data: Mass of each block is 1 kg, spring constant is 100 N/m, applied force is 10 N.
When block B just leaves the ground, the spring force equals the weight of block B.
The force exerted by the spring is given by Hooke's Law: F_s = k * x.
The spring force equals the weight of block B: F_s = m * g.
The net force acting on block A is the applied force minus the spring force: F_net = 10 - 9.8 = 0.2 N.
The acceleration of block A is given by Newton's second law: a = F_net / m = 0.2 / 1 = 0.2 m/s^2.
The magnitude of the initial acceleration of A is 0.2 m/s^2.
